alert.note: Alert for Colquitt; Cook; Tift; Worth (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 11 at 7:04PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Cook, northern Colquitt, southwestern Tift and southeastern Worth Counties through 745 PM EDT... At 704 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Norman Park, or near Moultrie, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Moultrie, Tifton, Omega, Norman Park, Lenox, Doerun, Riverside, Schley, Funston, Cool Spring, Eldorado, Staunton, Barneyville, Flat Ford, Minnesota, Wagon Wheel, Tift Airport, Sigsbee, Fender and Crosland. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
